body_html:
Broadly speaking, there are two things holding training in languages other than python up. One is support for gradients (#6268) and the other is the fact that the "control logic" for training (optimizers, estimators etc.) are in python.

#6268 talks about covering gradients. Once that is is resolved (and that might be a while), we'll have enough functionality in these languages to build up the control logic.

With that said, I'm tempted to close this out as a duplicate of #6268.

With that said, I'm tempted to close this out as a duplicate of #6268.
body:
Broadly speaking, there are two things holding training in languages other than python up. One is support for gradients (#6268) and the other is the fact that the "control logic" for training (optimizers, estimators etc.) are in python.

#6268 talks about covering gradients. Once that is is resolved (and that might be a while), we'll have enough functionality in these languages to build up the control logic.

With that said, I'm tempted to close this out as a duplicate of #6268.
